org.gridfour.imaging.palette

Class ColorPaletteTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gridfour.imaging.palette.ColorPaletteTable

  • public class ColorPaletteTable
extends Object
    Provides methods and data elements for a color table corresponding to the conventions of the CPT file format, but available for other application-defined uses.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorPaletteTable(List<ColorPaletteRecord> recordsList, Color background, Color foreground, Color colorForNull)
      Constructs an instance based on the specified list of color palette records and optional background, foreground, and null-value colors.
      ColorPaletteTable(List<ColorPaletteRecord> recordsList, Color background, Color foreground, Color colorForNull, boolean hingeFlag, double hingeValue, boolean normalized, double normalizedRangeMin, double normalizedRangeMax)
      Constructs an instance based on the specified list of color palette records and optional background, foreground, and null-value colors.

      • ColorPaletteTable

        public ColorPaletteTable(List<ColorPaletteRecord> recordsList,
                         Color background,
                         Color foreground,
                         Color colorForNull)
        Constructs an instance based on the specified list of color palette records and optional background, foreground, and null-value colors.
        Parameters:
        recordsList - a valid, non-empty list of specifications
        background - an optional background color; defaults white
        foreground - an optional foreground color; defaults to black
        colorForNull - an optional color value for null; defaults to null

      • ColorPaletteTable

        public ColorPaletteTable(List<ColorPaletteRecord> recordsList,
                         Color background,
                         Color foreground,
                         Color colorForNull,
                         boolean hingeFlag,
                         double hingeValue,
                         boolean normalized,
                         double normalizedRangeMin,
                         double normalizedRangeMax)
        Constructs an instance based on the specified list of color palette records and optional background, foreground, and null-value colors.
        Parameters:
        recordsList - a valid, non-empty list of specifications
        background - an optional background color; defaults white
        foreground - an optional foreground color; defaults to black
        colorForNull - an optional color value for null; defaults to null
        normalized - indicates whether the overall range of values for the internal palette records are normalized.
        hingeFlag - indicates whether a hinge value is supplied
        hingeValue - indicates the hinge value (ignored if hinge flag is false)
        normalizedRangeMin - indicates minimum range
        normalizedRangeMax - indicates maximum range

    • Method Detail

      • copyWithModifiedRange

        public ColorPaletteTable copyWithModifiedRange(double minRangeSpec,
                                               double maxRangeSpec)
        Copy the table and modify the range of values to match the specified parameters. This method is intended to support cases where the range of values for a palette needs to be stretched or contracted to match a range of values for input data.

        There are a few important restrictions on what palettes can be modified using this method:

        1. If the palette includes a hinge, then the range of values must span the hinge value.
        2. At this time, this method cannot be used on categorical palettes.
        3. The minimum and maximum range specifications must be finite values and the minimum range must be less than the maximum.
        Parameters:
        minRangeSpec - a finite value less than the maximum range specification.
        maxRangeSpec - a finite value greater than the minimum range specification.
        Returns:
        a valid color palette table.

      • getBackground

        public Color getBackground()
        Gets the application-defined background color.
        Returns:
        a valid instance

      • getForeground

        public Color getForeground()
        Gets the application-defined foreground color.
        Returns:
        a valid instance

      • getColorForNull

        public Color getColorForNull()
        Gets the application-defined color for null.
        Returns:
        if supplied by the application, a valid instance; otherwise, a null.

      • getRangeMin

        public double getRangeMin()
        Gets the minimum value for which an asociated color is defined by the table.
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value.

      • getRangeMax

        public double getRangeMax()
        Gets the maximum value for which an asociated color is defined by the table.
        Returns:
        a valid floating point value.

      • getArgb

        public int getArgb(double zTarget)
        Gets an ARGB value for the specified parameter, if available. If the color table does not define a color value for the specified parameter, this method will return the ARGB code for a null value. If the value is outside the specified range of values for the palette, this method will return the ARGB code for a null value.
        Parameters:
        zTarget - a valid floating point value
        Returns:
        if a color is defined for z, its associated ARGB value; otherwise the null-value code.

      • getArgbUnlimitedRange

        public int getArgbUnlimitedRange(double zTarget)
        Gets an ARGB value for the specified parameter, if available. If the target value is outside the range supported by this palette, the return value will be the ARGB associated with either the minimum or maximum values supported by the palette. If the palette features gaps in its coverage, it is still possible that a target value map fall within one of the gaps. But no limit is imposed for the range of supported values.
        Parameters:
        zTarget - a valid floating point value
        Returns:
        if a color is defined for z, its associated ARGB value; otherwise the null-value code.

      • getColor

        public Color getColor(double z)
        Gets the color associated with the parameter z; if no color is defined for z, the null-data color will be returned.
        Parameters:
        z - a valid floating point value
        Returns:
        if defined, a valid instance; if undefined the null-data color reference (which may be null).

      • isCovered

        public boolean isCovered(double z)
        Indicates whether this table defines a color value for the specified parameter.
        Parameters:
        z - a valid floating point valid
        Returns:
        true if a color is associated with the value; otherwise, false.

      • isCategoricalPalette

        public boolean isCategoricalPalette()
        Indicates that all records in the palette provide a single value rather than a range of values. This configuration would occur in palettes used to color code category-based (e.g. "categorical") data sets rather than real-valued data sets.
        Returns:
        true if the palette is designed for categorical data sets; otherwise, false.

      • isNormalized

        public boolean isNormalized()
        Indicates whether the palette is based on a normalization scheme in which the color levels run from either 0 to 1 or -1 to 1 (with a hinge value).
        Returns:
        true if the palette is normalized; otherwise, false.

      • isHinged

        public boolean isHinged()
        Indicates whether the palette includes a "hinge". The hinge feature allows a palette to specify a split palette in which the lower and upper ranges of colors are treated as separate palettes. Typically, this feature is used for normalized palettes.
        Returns:
        true if the palette specifies a hinge; otherwise false.

      • getHingeValue

        public double getHingeValue()
        For hinged palettes, this method returns the value at which the color scheme switches from the lower-range palette to the upper-range palette. The hinge value is only meaningful for hinged palettes.
        Returns:
        a finite floating-point value.

      • getHingeIndex

        public int getHingeIndex()
        For hinged palettes, this method returns the color record index at which the color scheme switches from the lower-range palette to the upper range palette. This hinge index is only meaningful for a hinged palette.
        Returns:
        a positive integer

      • getRecords

        public List<ColorPaletteRecord> getRecords()
        Gets an in-order list of the records in this palette.
        Returns:
        a valid list.
